metadata.Title: CVE-2014-6414 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
OpenStack Neutron before 2014.2.4 and 2014.1 before 2014.1.2 allows remote authenticated users to set admin network attributes to default values via unspecified vectors.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-6414` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

neutron-common - 1:2014.1.3-0ubuntu1
neutron-dhcp-agent - 1:2014.1.3-0ubuntu1
neutron-l3-agent - 1:2014.1.3-0ubuntu1
neutron-lbaas-agent - 1:2014.1.3-0ubuntu1
neutron-metadata-agent - 1:2014.1.3-0ubuntu1
neutron-metering-agent - 1:2014.1.3-0ubuntu1
neutron-plugin-bigswitch - 1:2014.1.3-0ubuntu1
neutron-plugin-bigswitch-agent - 1:2014.1.3-0ubuntu1
neutron-plugin-brocade - 1:2014.1.3-0ubuntu1

neutron-plugin-hyperv - 1:2014.1.3-0ubuntu1
neutron-plugin-ibm - 1:2014.1.3-0ubuntu1
neutron-plugin-ibm-agent - 1:2014.1.3-0ubuntu1

neutron-plugin-linuxbridge-agent - 1:2014.1.3-0ubuntu1

neutron-plugin-midonet - 1:2014.1.3-0ubuntu1
neutron-plugin-ml2 - 1:2014.1.3-0ubuntu1
neutron-plugin-mlnx - 1:2014.1.3-0ubuntu1
neutron-plugin-mlnx-agent - 1:2014.1.3-0ubuntu1
neutron-plugin-nec - 1:2014.1.3-0ubuntu1
neutron-plugin-nec-agent - 1:2014.1.3-0ubuntu1
neutron-plugin-nicira - 1:2014.1.3-0ubuntu1

neutron-plugin-oneconvergence-agent - 1:2014.1.3-0ubuntu1

neutron-plugin-openvswitch - 1:2014.1.3-0ubuntu1
neutron-plugin-openvswitch-agent - 1:2014.1.3-0ubuntu1
neutron-plugin-plumgrid - 1:2014.1.3-0ubuntu1

No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> description is wrong, will actually be fixed in 2014.1.3

criterions.comment: neutron package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2014.1.3-0ubuntu1').
